definition: to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.english: Those opinions and propositions were agreed upon and echoed by many participating leaders.
sentences.chinese: 這些觀點和主張得到許多與會領導人的贊同和呼應。

sentences.english: Zhiwu Chen, a professor of finance at Yale, agrees.
sentences.chinese: 耶魯大學的金融學教授陳志武也贊同這一看法。

sentences.english: You may wonder how many of his peers would agree with him.
sentences.chinese: 你或許會好奇他的同行中有幾個人贊同他的觀點。

sentences.english: Laureen approves her husband's political views and once canvassed for him.
sentences.chinese: 她贊同丈夫的政治觀點，並親自開車上陣爲丈夫助選。
筆者贊同王元化的觀點。

sentences.english: Hou Yiling, English literature professor at Beijing Foreign Studies University, agrees.
sentences.chinese: 北京外國語大學英語系教授侯毅凌對此表示贊同。

sentences.english: In my experience, I would agree with that statement.
sentences.chinese: 以我的經驗，我更傾向與贊同第二種說法。

sentences.english: Her mother sparked to the idea of an early wedding date.
sentences.chinese: 她母親悵然贊同早日舉行婚禮的計劃。

sentences.english: Are you in favor of workers' control of companied ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否贊同由工人管理公司？

sentences.english: After the war, two-thirds of the people of Hawaii supported statehood.
sentences.chinese: 戰後，夏威夷三分之二人贊同獲得美國州的地位。
這點很重要的，我非常贊同。

sentences.english: Badawi agreed with Jia's comments and proposals on bilateral relations.
sentences.chinese: 巴達維贊同賈慶林對兩國關係的評價和提出的建議。

sentences.english: Democrats generally endorse the cap-and-trade plan in the bill.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人普遍贊同議案中的限制和貿易計劃。

sentences.english: Yu's words were echoed by Ren Zhonglun, chairman of Shanghai Film Group.
sentences.chinese: 上海電影集團董事長任仲倫也表示贊同。

definition: to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
